tables.name: audit_log_entries
tables.comment: Auth: Audit trail for user actions.

indexes.name: audit_log_entries_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX audit_log_entries_pkey ON auth.audit_log_entries USING btree (id)

indexes.name: audit_logs_instance_id_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX audit_logs_instance_id_idx ON auth.audit_log_entries USING btree (instance_id)

tables.name: flow_state
tables.comment: stores metadata for pkce logins

indexes.name: flow_state_created_at_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX flow_state_created_at_idx ON auth.flow_state USING btree (created_at DESC)

indexes.name: flow_state_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX flow_state_pkey ON auth.flow_state USING btree (id)

indexes.name: idx_auth_code
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX idx_auth_code ON auth.flow_state USING btree (auth_code)

indexes.name: idx_user_id_auth_method
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX idx_user_id_auth_method ON auth.flow_state USING btree (user_id, authentication_method)

tables.name: identities
tables.comment: Auth: Stores identities associated to a user.

columns.name: email
columns.comment: Auth: Email is a generated column that references the optional email property in the identity_data

indexes.name: identities_email_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX identities_email_idx ON auth.identities USING btree (email text_pattern_ops)

indexes.name: identities_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX identities_pkey ON auth.identities USING btree (id)

indexes.name: identities_provider_id_provider_unique
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX identities_provider_id_provider_unique ON auth.identities USING btree (provider_id, provider)

indexes.name: identities_user_id_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX identities_user_id_idx ON auth.identities USING btree (user_id)

tables.name: instances
tables.comment: Auth: Manages users across multiple sites.

indexes.name: instances_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX instances_pkey ON auth.instances USING btree (id)

tables.name: mfa_amr_claims
tables.comment: auth: stores authenticator method reference claims for multi factor authentication

indexes.name: amr_id_pk
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX amr_id_pk ON auth.mfa_amr_claims USING btree (id)

indexes.name: mfa_amr_claims_session_id_authentication_method_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX mfa_amr_claims_session_id_authentication_method_pkey ON auth.mfa_amr_claims USING btree (session_id, authentication_method)

tables.name: mfa_challenges
tables.comment: auth: stores metadata about challenge requests made

indexes.name: mfa_challenge_created_at_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX mfa_challenge_created_at_idx ON auth.mfa_challenges USING btree (created_at DESC)

indexes.name: mfa_challenges_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX mfa_challenges_pkey ON auth.mfa_challenges USING btree (id)

tables.name: mfa_factors
tables.comment: auth: stores metadata about factors

columns.name: last_webauthn_challenge_data
columns.comment: Stores the latest WebAuthn challenge data including attestation/assertion for customer verification

indexes.name: factor_id_created_at_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX factor_id_created_at_idx ON auth.mfa_factors USING btree (user_id, created_at)

indexes.name: mfa_factors_last_challenged_at_key
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX mfa_factors_last_challenged_at_key ON auth.mfa_factors USING btree (last_challenged_at)

indexes.name: mfa_factors_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX mfa_factors_pkey ON auth.mfa_factors USING btree (id)

indexes.name: mfa_factors_user_friendly_name_unique
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX mfa_factors_user_friendly_name_unique ON auth.mfa_factors USING btree (friendly_name, user_id) WHERE (TRIM(BOTH FROM friendly_name) <> ''::text)

indexes.name: mfa_factors_user_id_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX mfa_factors_user_id_idx ON auth.mfa_factors USING btree (user_id)

indexes.name: unique_phone_factor_per_user
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX unique_phone_factor_per_user ON auth.mfa_factors USING btree (user_id, phone)

indexes.name: oauth_auth_pending_exp_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX oauth_auth_pending_exp_idx ON auth.oauth_authorizations USING btree (expires_at) WHERE (status = 'pending'::auth.oauth_authorization_status)

indexes.name: oauth_authorizations_authorization_code_key
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX oauth_authorizations_authorization_code_key ON auth.oauth_authorizations USING btree (authorization_code)

indexes.name: oauth_authorizations_authorization_id_key
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX oauth_authorizations_authorization_id_key ON auth.oauth_authorizations USING btree (authorization_id)

indexes.name: oauth_authorizations_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX oauth_authorizations_pkey ON auth.oauth_authorizations USING btree (id)

indexes.name: oauth_clients_deleted_at_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX oauth_clients_deleted_at_idx ON auth.oauth_clients USING btree (deleted_at)

indexes.name: oauth_clients_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX oauth_clients_pkey ON auth.oauth_clients USING btree (id)

indexes.name: oauth_consents_active_client_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX oauth_consents_active_client_idx ON auth.oauth_consents USING btree (client_id) WHERE (revoked_at IS NULL)

indexes.name: oauth_consents_active_user_client_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX oauth_consents_active_user_client_idx ON auth.oauth_consents USING btree (user_id, client_id) WHERE (revoked_at IS NULL)

indexes.name: oauth_consents_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX oauth_consents_pkey ON auth.oauth_consents USING btree (id)

indexes.name: oauth_consents_user_client_unique
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX oauth_consents_user_client_unique ON auth.oauth_consents USING btree (user_id, client_id)

indexes.name: oauth_consents_user_order_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX oauth_consents_user_order_idx ON auth.oauth_consents USING btree (user_id, granted_at DESC)

indexes.name: one_time_tokens_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX one_time_tokens_pkey ON auth.one_time_tokens USING btree (id)

indexes.name: one_time_tokens_relates_to_hash_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX one_time_tokens_relates_to_hash_idx ON auth.one_time_tokens USING hash (relates_to)

indexes.name: one_time_tokens_token_hash_hash_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX one_time_tokens_token_hash_hash_idx ON auth.one_time_tokens USING hash (token_hash)

indexes.name: one_time_tokens_user_id_token_type_key
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX one_time_tokens_user_id_token_type_key ON auth.one_time_tokens USING btree (user_id, token_type)

tables.name: refresh_tokens

indexes.name: refresh_tokens_instance_id_user_id_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX refresh_tokens_instance_id_user_id_idx ON auth.refresh_tokens USING btree (instance_id, user_id)

indexes.name: refresh_tokens_parent_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX refresh_tokens_parent_idx ON auth.refresh_tokens USING btree (parent)

indexes.name: refresh_tokens_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX refresh_tokens_pkey ON auth.refresh_tokens USING btree (id)

indexes.name: refresh_tokens_session_id_revoked_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX refresh_tokens_session_id_revoked_idx ON auth.refresh_tokens USING btree (session_id, revoked)

indexes.name: refresh_tokens_token_unique
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX refresh_tokens_token_unique ON auth.refresh_tokens USING btree (token)

indexes.name: refresh_tokens_updated_at_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX refresh_tokens_updated_at_idx ON auth.refresh_tokens USING btree (updated_at DESC)

tables.name: saml_providers
tables.comment: Auth: Manages SAML Identity Provider connections.

indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX saml_providers_entity_id_key ON auth.saml_providers USING btree (entity_id)

indexes.name: saml_providers_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX saml_providers_pkey ON auth.saml_providers USING btree (id)

indexes.name: saml_providers_sso_provider_id_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX saml_providers_sso_provider_id_idx ON auth.saml_providers USING btree (sso_provider_id)

tables.name: saml_relay_states
tables.comment: Auth: Contains SAML Relay State information for each Service Provider initiated login.

indexes.name: saml_relay_states_created_at_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX saml_relay_states_created_at_idx ON auth.saml_relay_states USING btree (created_at DESC)

indexes.name: saml_relay_states_for_email_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX saml_relay_states_for_email_idx ON auth.saml_relay_states USING btree (for_email)

indexes.name: saml_relay_states_sso_provider_id_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX saml_relay_states_sso_provider_id_idx ON auth.saml_relay_states USING btree (sso_provider_id)

tables.name: schema_migrations
tables.comment: Auth: Manages updates to the auth system.

indexes.name: schema_migrations_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX schema_migrations_pkey ON auth.schema_migrations USING btree (version)

tables.name: sessions
tables.comment: Auth: Stores session data associated to a user.

columns.name: not_after
columns.comment: Auth: Not after is a nullable column that contains a timestamp after which the session should be regarded as expired.

columns.name: refresh_token_counter
columns.comment: Holds the ID (counter) of the last issued refresh token.

columns.name: refresh_token_hmac_key
columns.comment: Holds a HMAC-SHA256 key used to sign refresh tokens for this session.

indexes.name: sessions_not_after_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX sessions_not_after_idx ON auth.sessions USING btree (not_after DESC)

indexes.name: sessions_oauth_client_id_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX sessions_oauth_client_id_idx ON auth.sessions USING btree (oauth_client_id)

indexes.name: sessions_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX sessions_pkey ON auth.sessions USING btree (id)

indexes.name: sessions_user_id_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX sessions_user_id_idx ON auth.sessions USING btree (user_id)

indexes.name: user_id_created_at_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX user_id_created_at_idx ON auth.sessions USING btree (user_id, created_at)

tables.name: sso_domains
tables.comment: Auth: Manages SSO email address domain mapping to an SSO Identity Provider.

indexes.name: sso_domains_domain_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX sso_domains_domain_idx ON auth.sso_domains USING btree (lower(domain))

indexes.name: sso_domains_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX sso_domains_pkey ON auth.sso_domains USING btree (id)

indexes.name: sso_domains_sso_provider_id_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX sso_domains_sso_provider_id_idx ON auth.sso_domains USING btree (sso_provider_id)

tables.name: sso_providers
tables.comment: Auth: Manages SSO identity provider information; see saml_providers for SAML.

columns.name: resource_id
columns.comment: Auth: Uniquely identifies a SSO provider according to a user-chosen resource ID (case insensitive), useful in infrastructure as code.

indexes.name: sso_providers_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX sso_providers_pkey ON auth.sso_providers USING btree (id)

indexes.name: sso_providers_resource_id_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX sso_providers_resource_id_idx ON auth.sso_providers USING btree (lower(resource_id))

indexes.name: sso_providers_resource_id_pattern_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX sso_providers_resource_id_pattern_idx ON auth.sso_providers USING btree (resource_id text_pattern_ops)

tables.name: users
tables.comment: Auth: Stores user login data within a secure schema.

columns.name: is_sso_user
columns.comment: Auth: Set this column to true when the account comes from SSO. These accounts can have duplicate emails.

indexes.name: confirmation_token_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX confirmation_token_idx ON auth.users USING btree (confirmation_token) WHERE ((confirmation_token)::text !~ '^[0-9 ]*$'::text)

indexes.name: email_change_token_current_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX email_change_token_current_idx ON auth.users USING btree (email_change_token_current) WHERE ((email_change_token_current)::text !~ '^[0-9 ]*$'::text)

indexes.name: email_change_token_new_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX email_change_token_new_idx ON auth.users USING btree (email_change_token_new) WHERE ((email_change_token_new)::text !~ '^[0-9 ]*$'::text)

indexes.name: reauthentication_token_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX reauthentication_token_idx ON auth.users USING btree (reauthentication_token) WHERE ((reauthentication_token)::text !~ '^[0-9 ]*$'::text)

indexes.name: recovery_token_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX recovery_token_idx ON auth.users USING btree (recovery_token) WHERE ((recovery_token)::text !~ '^[0-9 ]*$'::text)

indexes.name: users_email_partial_key
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX users_email_partial_key ON auth.users USING btree (email) WHERE (is_sso_user = false)

indexes.name: users_instance_id_email_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX users_instance_id_email_idx ON auth.users USING btree (instance_id, lower((email)::text))

indexes.name: users_instance_id_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX users_instance_id_idx ON auth.users USING btree (instance_id)

indexes.name: users_is_anonymous_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX users_is_anonymous_idx ON auth.users USING btree (is_anonymous)

indexes.name: users_phone_key
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX users_phone_key ON auth.users USING btree (phone)

indexes.name: users_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX users_pkey ON auth.users USING btree (id)

indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX idx_applications_slug ON public.applications USING btree (slug)

indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX idx_related_products_main ON public.related_products USING btree (product_variant_id)

indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX idx_related_products_related ON public.related_products USING btree (related_variant_id)

indexes.name: related_products_product_variant_id_related_variant_id_key
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX related_products_product_variant_id_related_variant_id_key ON public.related_products USING btree (product_variant_id, related_variant_id)

tables.name: size_formats
tables.comment: Formatos standard reutilizveis (A3, A4, A5, etc).

indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX idx_size_formats_name ON public.size_formats USING btree (name)

indexes.name: size_formats_name_key
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX size_formats_name_key ON public.size_formats USING btree (name)

indexes.name: size_formats_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX size_formats_pkey ON public.size_formats USING btree (id)

columns.name: owner
columns.comment: Field is deprecated, use owner_id instead

indexes.name: bname
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX bname ON storage.buckets USING btree (name)

indexes.name: buckets_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX buckets_pkey ON storage.buckets USING btree (id)

indexes.name: buckets_analytics_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX buckets_analytics_pkey ON storage.buckets_analytics USING btree (id)

columns.name: owner
columns.comment: Field is deprecated, use owner_id instead

indexes.name: bucketid_objname
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX bucketid_objname ON storage.objects USING btree (bucket_id, name)

indexes.name: idx_name_bucket_level_unique
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX idx_name_bucket_level_unique ON storage.objects USING btree (name COLLATE "C", bucket_id, level)

indexes.name: idx_objects_bucket_id_name
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX idx_objects_bucket_id_name ON storage.objects USING btree (bucket_id, name COLLATE "C")

indexes.name: idx_objects_lower_name
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX idx_objects_lower_name ON storage.objects USING btree ((path_tokens[level]), lower(name) text_pattern_ops, bucket_id, level)

indexes.name: name_prefix_search
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX name_prefix_search ON storage.objects USING btree (name text_pattern_ops)

indexes.name: objects_bucket_id_level_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX objects_bucket_id_level_idx ON storage.objects USING btree (bucket_id, level, name COLLATE "C")

indexes.name: objects_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX objects_pkey ON storage.objects USING btree (id)

indexes.name: idx_prefixes_lower_name
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX idx_prefixes_lower_name ON storage.prefixes USING btree (bucket_id, level, ((string_to_array(name, '/'::text))[level]), lower(name) text_pattern_ops)

indexes.name: prefixes_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX prefixes_pkey ON storage.prefixes USING btree (bucket_id, level, name)

indexes.name: idx_multipart_uploads_list
indexes.definition: CREATE INDEX idx_multipart_uploads_list ON storage.s3_multipart_uploads USING btree (bucket_id, key, created_at)

indexes.name: s3_multipart_uploads_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX s3_multipart_uploads_pkey ON storage.s3_multipart_uploads USING btree (id)

indexes.name: s3_multipart_uploads_parts_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX s3_multipart_uploads_parts_pkey ON storage.s3_multipart_uploads_parts USING btree (id)

tables.name: secrets
tables.comment: Table with encrypted `secret` column for storing sensitive information on disk.

indexes.name: secrets_name_idx
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX secrets_name_idx ON vault.secrets USING btree (name) WHERE (name IS NOT NULL)

indexes.name: secrets_pkey
indexes.definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX secrets_pkey ON vault.secrets USING btree (id)
